section.name: About
section.p: The UI-Toolkit (UIT) is an abstraction layer for user-interface (UI) toolkits as Swing, SWT, JSF, or XUL.

section.name: Goals
section.p:
The UI-Toolkit archieves the following goals:
clean, simple, high-level and easy to use API
same client-codebase runs with all underlying native toolkits
choose toolkit implementation at run-time
hide strange and touchy behaviours of existing toolkits
do not focus on gimmics

section.name: Why?
section.p: Are you unsure which technology will be the right decision for your client application? Did you ever migrate an existing client application from one technology to another? Did you ever try to maintain a client application for different technologies?
If you may answer one of this questions with "yes", this project could be interesting for you.

section.name: Alternatives
section.p: If you have an existing SWT application you can run it as Swing application via SWTSwing.
If you have an existing Swing application you can run it as SWT application via SwingWT or as web-application using WingS.
If you start from scratch writing your client choose the UI-Toolkit!
